data.description: Requests that only an exact match on a prefix beÂ performed. If no exact match is found no objects are returned.
Returns first level less specific inetnum, inet6num or route(6) objects, excluding exact matches.
Returns all level less specific inetnum, inet6num or route(6) objects, including exact matches.
Returns first level more specific inetnum, inet6num or route(6) objects, excluding exact matches.
Returns all level more specific inetnum, inet6num or route(6) objects, excluding exact matches.
Turns off '-c' or '--irt' flag. Related irt objects are not returned by default.
Requests first level less specific inetnum or inet6num objects with the "mnt-irt:" attribute. Related irt objects are not returned by default.
Requests the "abuse-mailbox:" address related to the specified inetnum or inet6num object. Only specified object key and "abuse-mailbox:" attributes are shown.
When used with hierarchical flags (like --one-less), both address and route object types and domain object types are returned.
Perform an inverse query.
Produce output using short hand notation for attribute names.

Requests that only the primary keys of an object to be returned. The exceptions are set objects, where the (mp-)members attributes will also be returned. This flag does not apply to person and role objects.

Requests a persistent connection. After returning the result the connection will not be closed by the server and a client may issue multiple queries on the same connection.
Note, that server implements 'stop-and-wait' protocol, when no next query can be sent before receiving a reply for the previous one.
Except the first -k query, -k without an argument closes the persistent connection.
Disables the grouping of objects by relevance.
Disables the filtering of "notify:" and "e-mail:" attributes.
Returns only syntactically correct objects
Returns only syntactically incorrect objects
Switches off tagging information.
Switches on tagging information.
Show only objects with given tag(s)
Do not show objects with given tag(s)
Switches off referenced lookup for related information after retrieving the objects that match the query string.
Filter PERSON and ROLE objects from results
Include PERSON and ROLE objects in results
Select the types of objects to lookup in the query.
Specifies that the server should perform lookups in all available sources. See also the "-q sources" query.
Specifies which sources and in which order are to be looked up when performing a query.
Search all sources for resources and returns the authoritative one. Placeholders are omitted.

"sources"  see list-sources.
"version"  see version.
"types"    show all object types.
Returns the current set of sources along with the information required for mirroring. See [REF], section 2.9 "Other server features" for more information.
Displays the current version of the server.
List of available RPSL object types.
Requests a template for the specified object type.
Requests a verbose template for the specified object type.
Sends information about the client to the server.
Returns a list of historical versions of the object
Returns a difference between two versions of the object
Returns historical version of the object
